intro: Phyllanthus niruri var. javanicus, commonly known as Java stonecress, is a tropical plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and tiny yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found growing in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it a hardy species adaptable to various soil types.
